bibRefCitation.author: Borchmann

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined and literature records.
[ Otjozondjupa ] Okahandja : Okahandja Gross Barmen , 22.1000°S 16.7500°E (CB).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Hycleus herero
: tegmen and aedeagus in lateral view (A); mesosternum (B); male stype (C); male maxillary palpi (D). Bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks . Type of this species was not examined and is probably lost.

Bologna (2000a) hypothesized the synonymy of this species with
H. hybridus
. Actually, after the examination of the male specimen from Okahandja, which strictly agrees with the description, we consider
H . herero
as a distinct species. It differs from
H. hybridus
, a species widespread in
Namibia
, at least by the following characters: (i) fore margin of fore depression of male maxillary stipes squared and posteriorly delimited by a shiny expansion, while in
hybridus
this depression is oval and rounded in front; (ii) punctures of head, pronotum and elytra very deep and approached; (iii) elytral red and black colouration clean and not vanished as in
hybridus
.

In
Figs. 15 A –D
are illustrated: male genitalia in lateral view (
Fig. 15 A
), mesosternum ( Fig. 15B ); male stype ( Fig. 15C ) and male maxillary palpi ( Fig. 15D ).

bibRefCitation.author: Marseul

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. Angola , Botswana ,
Namibia
, and northwestern
South Africa
.
Remarks. Types of this species were examined at MNHN .

See above for the distinction from
H. herero ( Borchmann, 1940 )
.
